meanings.definition: To destroy completely; put an end to.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was eradicating the weeds from his garden.
meanings.sent2: The government is eradicating the disease through vaccination programs.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's power was eradicating all evil in the city.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was eradicating all traces of sadness from his heart.
meanings.sent5: The storm was eradicating everything in its path with fierce winds and rain.

meanings.definition: To pull up by the roots.
meanings.sent1: She was eradicating the stubborn weeds from the flower bed.
meanings.sent2: The gardener eradicating the invasive plants to protect the native species.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was eradicating all the buried nuts from the ground.
meanings.sent4: The detective was eradicating the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The storm was eradicating the trees, pulling them up by their roots with its powerful winds.

meanings.sent1: The company was eradicating all traces of the old system to implement a new one.
meanings.sent2: The team was eradicating the competition with their innovative strategies.
meanings.sent3: The magician was eradicating all the playing cards from the deck.
meanings.sent4: The virus was eradicating the computer files, wiping them out completely.
meanings.sent5: The flood was eradicating the town, eliminating everything in its path.
